title: Extend clang-cross to support alpine
body:
**Description of Change**

Share clang-cross infra between debian and alpine to avoid duplication. Enable arm64 and riscv64 alpine builds in CI.

**Bugs Fixed**

- Followup on #3192

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
For a separate reason (#3201) I have been working on this PR: https://github.com/mono/SkiaSharp/pull/3209

I noticed that I can build everything on Debian 10 still - and would prefer to do so to get more version coverage. I know you/this PR is refactoring things, but after my PR there will be only one Docker file. Hopefully. We may still need this refactoring if we merge the #3198 PR to add LoongArch64. That looks like it may need Debian 13 so may be worth a totally separate Dockerfile if things go a bit different.

Not sure if you have any thoughts on my PR?

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
Ah, I am a bit dumb - you are also adding an alpine cross. So yeah, this PR is still needed.

But, it would still be good to get @kasperk81 and @4Darmygeometry eyes on that to make sure I am not breaking something for later PRs

comments.author: 4Darmygeometry
comments.body:
apk.static for loongarch64 can be download in http://dl-cdn.alpinelinux.org/alpine/v3.21/main/loongarch64/apk-tools-static-2.14.6-r3.apk.
The apk.static needs to be updated to version 2.14.6 to ensure compatibility with both RISC-V64 and LoongArch64
